alert.note: Alert for San Francisco (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 11 at 3:25PM PST until January 11 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Alameda, Contra Costa and San Francisco. * WHEN...Until 930 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 325 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.2 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Francisco, Oakland, Fremont, Hayward, Berkeley, Richmond, San Leandro, Livermore, Alameda, San Ramon, Pleasanton, Union City, Walnut Creek, Dublin, Newark, Danville, San Pablo, Lafayette, El Cerrito and Castro Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
